    isogasex: Isotopic Gas Exchange

    R package documentation for TDL and Licor data processing

    Erik B. Erhardt and David T. Hanson

    June 06, 2019

    isogasex_user_guide.Rmd

    Installation

    Install R

    R and Perl are required. Rstudio may make your experience more enjoyable.

    1. R (requires R 2.15.1+)

      1. Windows (http://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/)
      2. Mac (http://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/)

    2. Rstudio

      1. Rstudio (http://www.rstudio.org/download/) nicer GUI

    3. Perl

      1. Mac and linux, you already have it installed

      2. Windows

        • http://www.activestate.com/activeperl/downloads
        • Change the path variable to include C:\Perl\bin (or whatever it is on your machine, and use backslashes): http://www.java.com/en/download/help/path.xml

    Install the isogasex and required packages

    Install the isogasex package

    From the shared dropbox folder ./TDL_R_scripts/ install the current version of isogasex.

    The package installation file will appear in a folder named something like

    1. ./isogasex_0.1-21_20121017-R2.15.1-template4/

    and will include two files, such as

    1. the package: isogasex_0.1-21.tar.gz
    2. and the template: isogasex_template4.xls

    There doesn’t seem to be a way to install local packages within R anymore, so it has to be done from the command prompt. From your shell or command prompt:

    1. Windows, open your command prompt (cmd), change to directory with install file, and install it (you need to get the correct path, filename, and R command name).

      1. cd C:\[your path]\TDL_R_scripts\isogasex_0.1-21_20121017-R2.15.1-template4
      2. "C:\Program Files\R\R-2.15.1\bin\x64\R" CMD INSTALL isogasex_0.1-21.tar.gz

    2. Mac, I can’t walk you through this since I don’t have access to a Mac right now, but it’s similar, probably something like this:

      1. cd ~/[your path]/TDL_R_scripts/isogasex_0.1-21_20121017-R2.15.1-template4
      2. R CMD INSTALL isogasex_0.1-21.tar.gz

    Copy the template file to your data directory before you rename and edit it.

    Install package dependencies

    These should install automatically with the command above. But if not, these commands will do it:

      XXX commands here

    Execution

    Try to avoid using spaces in your directory names (folder names) and file names.

    Analyze your TDL and/or Licor data

    1. Create a new data analysis directory, such as ./Name_WT001
    2. Copy your TDL and Licor files into your new dir
    3. Copy the isogasex_template4.xls into your new dir
    4. Append a meaningful suffix to the .xls file, such as isogasex_template4_Name_WT001.xls
    5. Edit the .xls file and specify the TDL and Licor filenames, and make any other necessary changes to template inputs.

    6. Load the library: (see end of doc for the remaining steps all together)

      1. library(isogasex)

    7. Assign the xls filename to a variable

      1. input.fn <- "isogasex_template4_Name_WT001.xls"

    8. Specify your new dir (using forward slashes for all systems is preferred)

      1. Mac, Linux:

        1. path <- "/Users/username/Analysis/Name_WT001"

      2. Windows:

        1. path <- "C:/Dropbox/Analysis/Name_WT001"

    9. Run the analysis

        1. `isogasex(input.fn, path)}
    10. It will create an ./out directory where output files are created.

    11. Documentation is available with ?isogasex

    Use a block of code like this, set your file name and directory, and copy/paste into R.

    library(isogasex)
# ?isogasex
input.fn <- "isogasex_template4_Name_WT001.xls"
path <- "/Users/username/Analysis/Name_WT001" # Mac
path <- "C:/Dropbox/Analysis/Name_WT001"      # Windows
isogasex(input.fn, path)

    Gas exchange calculations

    Constants

    While each of these values have their own associated uncertainty, we take them to be constant at their (accepted) values for an analysis. Common values are included below, though these may be changed in the template.

    \[ \begin{aligned} \dot{a}_{\textrm{b}} & \equiv & 2.96 {}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad\textrm{boundary} \\ \dot{a} & \equiv & 4.44 {}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad\textrm{stomata} \\ \dot{a}_{\textrm{w}} & \equiv & \dot{a}_{\textrm{l}}\equiv 0.7 {}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad\textrm{water} \\ \dot{b}_{\textrm{s}} & \equiv & 1.1 {}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad\textrm{CO2 entering solution at 20$^\textrm{o}$ C} \\ \dot{b} & \equiv & 29 {}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad\textrm{internal conductance via gm} \\ \dot{R}_\textrm{std 13C} & \equiv & 0.0111797 & \quad\textrm{C ratio of standard} \\ {\dot{\kappa}}_{\textrm{H}} & \equiv & (\dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}12}, \dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}13}) \equiv (473.3358029, 5.183209292) & \quad\textrm{concentration constants for high tanks} \\ {\dot{\kappa}}_{\textrm{L}} & \equiv & (\dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{L}12}, \dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{L}13}) \equiv (243.4737846, 2.666301131) & \quad\textrm{concentration constants for low tanks} \\ \dot{f}_{\textrm{13C}} & \equiv & 0.004922 & \quad\textrm{natural fractional abundance of C isotopologues not measured} \\ \dot{g}_{\textrm{bc}} & \equiv & 3 & \quad\textrm{conductance at the boundary level, can also be obtained from Licor} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    Data

    TDL

    Concentrations for high and low calibration tanks (H and L), reference gas entering the chamber (R), and chamber gas exiting the chamber (C).

    \[ \begin{aligned} \tilde{{\kappa}}_{\textrm{H}} & = & (\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}12},\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}13})^\top & \quad \\ \tilde{{\kappa}}_{\textrm{L}} & = & (\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{L}12},\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{L}13})^\top & \quad \\ \tilde{{\kappa}}_{\textrm{R}} & = & (\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{R}12},\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{R}13})^\top & \quad \\ \tilde{{\kappa}}_{\textrm{C}} & = & (\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{C}12},\tilde{\kappa}_{\textrm{C}13})^\top & \quad \\ \end{aligned} \]

    Licor

    \[ \begin{aligned} \tilde{p}_{\textrm{atm}} & \sim & \textrm{Normal}(p_{\textrm{atm}},\sigma_{p_{\textrm{atm}}}^2) & \quad \textrm{atmospheric pressure from Licor} \\ \tilde{A}_{} & \sim & \textrm{Normal}(A_{}, \sigma_{A}^2) & \quad \textrm{photosynthesis from Licor (can also calculate from TDL)} \\ \tilde{g}_{\textrm{tc}} & \sim & \textrm{Normal}(g_{\textrm{tc}}, \sigma_{g_{\textrm{tc}}}^2) & \quad \textrm{total conductance of CO_2} \\ \tilde{E}_{} & \sim & \textrm{Normal}(E_{}, \sigma_{E}^2) & \quad \textrm{transpiration rate (water vapor)} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    I have a note that \(\tilde{g}_{\textrm{tc}}\) is a function of \(\dot{g}_{\textrm{bc}}\), \(\dot{g}_{\textrm{sc}}\), \(\dot{a}_{\textrm{b}}\), \(\dot{g}_{\textrm{sc}}\), and \(\dot{g}_{\textrm{bc}}\).

    Calculations

    Concentration

    Offset

    \[ \begin{aligned} o_{\textrm{12}} & = & \dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}12}- g_{\textrm{12}}\kappa_{\textrm{H}12} & \quad \textrm{} \\ o_{\textrm{13}} & = & \dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}13}- g_{\textrm{13}}\kappa_{\textrm{H}13} & \quad \textrm{} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    Gain

    \[ \begin{aligned} g_{\textrm{12}} & = & (\dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}12}- \dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{L}12})(\kappa_{\textrm{H}12}- \kappa_{\textrm{L}12})^{-1} & \quad \textrm{} \\ g_{\textrm{13}} & = & (\dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{H}13}- \dot{\kappa}_{\textrm{L}13})(\kappa_{\textrm{H}13}- \kappa_{\textrm{L}13})^{-1} & \quad \textrm{} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    Corrected

    \[ \begin{aligned} \kappa_{\textrm{R}12}^{\prime} & = & \kappa_{\textrm{R}12}g_{\textrm{12}}+ o_{\textrm{12}} & \quad \textrm{Ref} \\ \kappa_{\textrm{R}13}^{\prime} & = & \kappa_{\textrm{R}13}g_{\textrm{13}}+ o_{\textrm{13}} & \quad \textrm{Ref} \\ \kappa_{\textrm{C}12}^{\prime} & = & \kappa_{\textrm{C}12}g_{\textrm{12}}+ o_{\textrm{12}} & \quad \textrm{Chamber} \\ \kappa_{\textrm{C}13}^{\prime} & = & \kappa_{\textrm{C}13}g_{\textrm{13}}+ o_{\textrm{13}} & \quad \textrm{Chamber} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    xi

    \[ \begin{aligned} \xi_{} & = & C_{\textrm{e}}(C_{\textrm{e}}-C_{\textrm{o}})^{-1} & \quad \textrm{} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    delta

    \[ \begin{aligned} \delta_{\textrm{e}} & = & \{ (\kappa_{\textrm{R}13}^{\prime}/\kappa_{\textrm{R}12}^{\prime})/\dot{R}_\textrm{std 13C}- 1 \} 10^3{}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad \textrm{Ref} \\ \delta_{\textrm{o}} & = & \{ (\kappa_{\textrm{C}13}^{\prime}/\kappa_{\textrm{C}12}^{\prime})/\dot{R}_\textrm{std 13C}- 1 \} 10^3{}^\textrm{o}\mkern-5mu/\mkern-3mu_\textrm{oo} & \quad \textrm{Chamber} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    Total mol fractions (paired, either both Licor or both TDL)

    \[ \begin{aligned} C_{\textrm{e}} & = (& \kappa_{\textrm{R}12}^{\prime}+\kappa_{\textrm{R}13}^{\prime})(1-\dot{f}_{\textrm{13C}})^{-1} & \quad \textrm{entering Reference} \\ C_{\textrm{a}} & \equiv & C_{\textrm{o}}= (\kappa_{\textrm{C}12}^{\prime}+\kappa_{\textrm{C}13}^{\prime})(1-\dot{f}_{\textrm{13C}})^{-1} & \quad \textrm{outgoing Chamber} \\ \end{aligned} \]

    Partial Pressures

    \[ \begin{aligned} p_{\textrm{a}} & = & (C_{\textrm{a}}10^{-6})(p_{\textrm{atm}}10^3) & \quad \textrm{atmosphere} \\ p_{\textrm{s}} & = & (C_{\textrm{s}}10^{-6})(p_{\textrm{atm}}10^3) & \quad \textrm{surface} \\ p_{\textrm{i}} & = & (C_{\textrm{i}}10^{-6})(p_{\textrm{atm}}10^3) & \quad \textrm{internal} \\ p_{\textrm{c}} & = & p_{\textrm{i}}- A_{}g_{\textrm{m}}^{-1} & \quad \textrm{(chloroplast) carboxylation site} \\ g_{\textrm{m}} & = & (\dot{b}- \dot{b}_{\textrm{s}}- \dot{a}_{\textrm{w}})A_{}p_{\textrm{a}}^{-1}(\Delta_{\textrm{pred}}-\Delta_{\textrm{obs}})^{-1} & \quad \textrm{}\\ \end{aligned} \]

    Discrimination

    {}

    \[ \begin{aligned} \Delta_{\textrm{obs}} & = & \xi_{}(\delta_{\textrm{o}}-\delta_{\textrm{e}})\{1+\delta_{\textrm{o}}-\xi_{}(\delta_{\textrm{o}}-\delta_{\textrm{e}})\}^{-1}10^3 & \quad \textrm{}\\ \Delta_{\textrm{pred}} & = & p_{\textrm{a}}^{-1} \{ \dot{a}_{\textrm{b}}(p_{\textrm{a}}-p_{\textrm{s}}) + \dot{a}(p_{\textrm{s}}-p_{\textrm{i}}) + \dot{b}p_{\textrm{c}}\} & \quad \textrm{}\\ \end{aligned} \]

    (circular, assume \(p_{\textrm{c}}\equiv p_{\textrm{i}}\))

    Leaf surface:

    \[ \begin{aligned} C_{\textrm{s}} & = & \{ (\dot{g}_{\textrm{bc}}- E_{}/2000)C_{\textrm{o}}- A_{}\} ( \dot{g}_{\textrm{bc}}+ E_{}/2000 )^{-1} & \quad \textrm{}\\ C_{\textrm{i}} & = & \{ (g_{\textrm{tc}}- E_{}/2000)C_{\textrm{o}}- A_{}\} ( g_{\textrm{tc}}+ E_{}/2000 )^{-1} & \quad \textrm{}\\ \end{aligned} \]

    Either of these values can be from the TDL or Licor: \(C_{\textrm{o}}\) and \(A_{}\).
